DataElement.preferredName: Serious Adverse Event Other Criterion Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator for when a serious adverse event is not covered by any other criteria that would describe it as "serious"

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to any other criteria that describes a serious adverse event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Causing fear or anxiety by threatening great harm; of great consequence.:Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Causing fear or anxiety by threatening great harm; of great consequence.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: dates on which adverse events were reported or observed.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 11/17/21 changed WS from Retired Deleted to Retired Archived and added end date. Workflow status set to "Retired Deleted" in 3.0 deployment, was previously Deleted using the Admin Tool "Delete" function key. This function is no longer available.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016
